SENT.plain: Two common mutations in the exon IIIa of fibroblast growth factor receptor 2 account for majority of the cases of Apert syndrome
They can be analyzed by amplifying the segment followed by testing for the abolition of restriction sites
We evaluated two children with typical features of Apert syndrome
A segment of FGFR2 exon IIIa was amplified by polymerase chain reaction
Restriction fragment length polymorphism was analyzed using enzymes MboI and BglI respectively for S252W and P253R mutations
The DNA segment was sequenced using ABI 310 automated DNA fragment analyzer
Both the patients showed S252W mutations
DNA sequencing confirmed the results of the restriction fragment length polymorphism
Our study is the first report from Indian subcontinent to show the prevalence of S252W mutation among Apert syndrome patients from Indian origin
